author: E. Marcel Pourtout mpourtout@neighbornewspapers.com (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Football programs continue region action
text: Football programs continue region action by E. Marcel Pourtout October 07, 2015 05:31 PM | 446 views | 0 | 1 | Special / Cecil CopelandNorth Atlanta defender Zachary Beckton making tackle attempt on Sprayberry’s Trey Sermon during contest earlier this season. slideshow With the prep football regular season entering its seventh week of action, each teams’ schedule consist of exclusively region contests which will determine their ultimate postseason fates.Riverwood will host North Springs this Friday, looking to continue its strong 2015 campaign in a Region 7 (B) battle. The Raiders have won four of their first five contests this year and earned wins in their first two region games. Junior running back Marvin Kinsey, Jr. has rushed for seven touchdowns this season while Porter Sanford has tossed five TD passes, four of which have been to Evan Crossing.In Riverwood’s 50-13 win over Forsyth Central on Sept. 24, Kinsey Jr. ran for a game-high 227 yards and a touchdown.“We have been playing like a team,” Riverwood coach Ben Stready said. “We cheer for one another, we encourage each another, and hold each other accountable for mistakes. It has been a real pleasure coaching these young men.” The Riverwood defense, which has allowed only eight points a contest this year, has been led by senior Jay Dukes who has a team-high six sacks and leading tacklers Cole Sutton and John Beckey.North Springs us coming off of a 33-7 loss at home against Sprayberry on Sept. 18. Riverwood and North Springs have faced each other every season since 2002 and previously met 35 times overall. North Springs holds the 22-12-1 series lead including a 24-17 home win last season.North Atlanta hopes to get back on the winning track this Friday in a Region 7 (B) contest at home against Forsyth Central out of Cumming. Both teams won their first two contests of the season but proceeded to produce three-game losing streaks. The host Warriors dropped their road contest at Sprayberry 37-7. Forsyth Central won last year’s contest against North Atlanta 7-0.Pace Academy looks to rebound off of its first loss of the season, returning to action at Region 6AA Greater Atlanta Christian in Norcross this Friday. The Knights won their first five games of the season but were defeated 18-8 at Wesleyan on Sept. 25. Pace Academy’s offense has been led by quarterback Gunnor Faulk who has 986 total yards and eight touchdowns on the season. The Knights’ defensive unit allows only 13 points a contest.Greater Atlanta Christian have started the year 5-1, defeating B.E.S.T. Academy on Sept. 25. GAC won last season’s contest against Pace Academy 37-7.Westminster will host Decatur this Friday in a Region 4AAA(B) contest. The Wildcats’ record for this season is 2-3 and they’re coming off of a 25-23 road loss to Therrell on Sept. 25. Decatur has won its last four contests after dropping its season opener to Woodward Academy. The Bulldogs defeated Washington 28-7 in their last contest.Westminster holds an 11-1 series lead over Decatur with the Bulldogs’ lone win coming in 1967. The Wildcats won last year’s contest 52-14.Lovett looks to extend its winning streak to three games when it hosts Hapeville Charter this Friday in Region 6AA. The Lions has a slow start to their 2015 campaign, losing their first four contests. However, they’ve rebounded with two straight wins over B.E.S.T. Academy and K.I.P.P. Atlanta.Hapeville has won four of its first five games and defeated Holy Innocents’ 32-26 on Sept. 26. Lovett has won all three contests against Hapeville including last year’s 48-8 road win. The Lions have outscored the Hornets by a combined score of 130-6 in their meetings.Holy Innocents’ will visit K.I.P.P Atlanta this Saturday looking to turnaround their 1-4 start to this season. The Golden Bears won last year’s contest 38-21.Mount Vernon Presbyterian has already matched last season’s win total with two victories this season and are looking for more as its visits Our Lady of Mercy in Fairburn this Friday. The Mustangs won their last contest 45-7 at Cross Keys in Atlanta behind three touchdown passes from Jacob Cavender. Jordan Taylor had a game-high 134 receiving yards and two touchdown catches while Ahmir Lee ran for two scores as well.Our Lady of Mercy has won all three previous meetings against Mount Vernon Presbyterian including last year’s 45-0 home victory.
